greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n+2) = (2*n + 3)*a(n+1) + (n + 1)^2*a(n), a(0) = 1, a(1) = 0.
comment: Numerators of the convergents of the generalized continued fraction expansion 4/Pi - 1 =  [0; 1/3, 4/5, 9/7,..., n^2/(2*n + 1),...] = 1/(3 + 4/(5 + 9/(7 + ...))). The first 4 convergents are 1/3, 5/19, 44/160 and 476/1744.
link: Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..392
K. S. Brown, Integer Sequences Related To Pi
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[n+2] == (2*n+3)*a[n+1] + (n+1)^2*a[n], a[0] == 1, a[1] == 0}, a, {n, 0, 25}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 18 2017 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 26 2000
